state_snapshot.user_input:
Evaluate the following candidate for the role of AI / ML Engineer using the resume content below. Assess technical fit, strengths, gaps, and readiness for an AI/ML engineering role. Calculate an overall fit score (0–100) and recommend whether the candidate should move forward in the hiring process or be rejected.

Resume Content:
Candidate Name: Shashank Singh
Summary: AI Engineer with hands-on experience in Python, Generative AI, LLMs, RAG pipelines, and agent-based systems. Skilled in designing and deploying AI-driven solutions using modern ML techniques, with a strong foundation in data analytics and system architecture. Previously managed high-impact production systems and key enterprise accounts, bringing a reliability-first mindset to building scalable, business-focused applications.

Education: Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science Engineering, DIT University, Dehradun. Graduated July 2024 with 8.31 CGPA.

Skills: Python; Machine Learning; Scikit-learn; Generative AI; Open-source LLMs; Prompt Engineering; LangChain; RAG; Agentic AI; Multi-Agent Systems; FAISS; MySQL; PostgreSQL; FastAPI; Streamlit; LangGraph; CrewAI; AutoGen; Kafka; Azure Cloud Services; Azure Foundry; Git/GitHub; MobiControl (MDM); SSMS; Client Communication; Problem-solving; Teamwork.

Experience:
– Executive Software Developer at KPMG India (Sept 2025 – Present): Built production-grade Generative AI applications, designed agentic and multi-agent workflows using LangGraph and CrewAI, and developed scalable FastAPI backends with strong error handling and modular architecture.
– Technical Analyst at SOTI (July 2024 – Sept 2025): Managed enterprise systems, performed root-cause analysis across application, database, and infrastructure layers, and supported production environments.
– Technical Support Associate Intern at SOTI (Feb 2024 – June 2024): Provided end-to-end technical support, database management, and networking/firewall troubleshooting.

Projects: EchoAI (agentic workflows with RAG), GSOC multi-agent AI chatbot using Kafka, real estate price prediction using ML, interactive AI chatbot using OpenAI and Streamlit, MCQ generator using OpenAI and LangChain, and Python-based web server log analysis.

Based on this resume, evaluate the candidate’s suitability for an AI / ML Engineer role, identify strengths and gaps relative to the role, compute a fit score, and provide a clear hire or reject recommendation.

state_snapshot.crew_result:
Based on the detailed resume provided, Shashank Singh demonstrates a strong technical fit for an AI / ML Engineer role, with extensive hands-on experience in generative AI, LLMs, RAG pipelines, and multi-agent systems—areas highly relevant to modern AI engineering. The candidate’s work at KPMG India showcases production-grade development of agentic workflows and scalable backend systems, signaling a solid understanding of both technical and business-oriented deployment. Their educational background and skill set, including Python, LangChain, FastAPI, FAISS, and cloud services (Azure), further reinforce their readiness for an advanced AI engineering position.

Strengths include:
- Real-world experience building and deploying production-grade AI solutions.
- Proficiency in agentic and agent-based systems, a growing area in AI engineering.
- Demonstrated ability to work with enterprise systems and troubleshoot across layers.
- Portfolio of end-to-end AI projects, from ML-based predictions to complex RAG and agentic chatbot flows.
- Strong backend and data infrastructure skills (FastAPI, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Kafka, FAISS).
- Exposure to both technical development and client-facing communication.

Gaps to consider:
- Limited explicit examples of optimizing performance or scalability of AI systems in production.
- No detailed description of a full deployment lifecycle from concept to production, or major technical challenges resolved.
- No explicit mention of advanced machine learning techniques (e.g., reinforcement learning, advanced NLP, AI safety).
- Background in technical support and analysis may require additional onboarding for a full engineering role.
- Current employment at KPMG India may necessitate further clarification on work arrangement and relocation logistics.

Overall Fit Score: 82/100

Recommendation: Shashank Singh should move forward in the hiring process. His technical background, hands-on experience, and relevant skill set make him a strong candidate for an AI / ML Engineer role. However, the next steps should include a technical interview to explore production system optimization and deployment lifecycle in more depth, as well as a discussion about work arrangements and commitment to the role.
